table.name: itinerary
table.description: This table defines the path between two locations. The itinerary is described in terms of the legs. An itinerary can have one or more legs. The itinerary table consists of the constraints on the weight allowed for shipment for each path. The itinerary can be used by a corporation or can specify additional constraints using the calendar GID like Monday-Friday Itinerary, Weekend Itinerary etc.

columns.name: ITINERARY_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the itinerary.

columns.name: ITINERARY_XID
columns.description: Contains the XID for the itinerary.

columns.name: ITINERARY_NAME
columns.description: Contains the name for the itinerary.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Contains text describing the itinerary.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT
columns.description: Contains the minimum weight for the shipment on the itinerary.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the minimum weight.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum weight in base units.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT
columns.description: Contains the maximum weight for the shipment on the itinerary.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum weight.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum weight in base units.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME
columns.description: Contains the minimum volume for the shipment on the itinerary.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the minimum volume.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: Minimum volume in base units.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME
columns.description: Contains the maximum volume for the shipment on the itinerary.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum volume.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: Maximum volume in base units.

columns.name: CORPORATION_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the corporation profile used for the itinerary.

columns.name: CALENDAR_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the calendar.

columns.name: X_LANE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the entity. It is created by concatenating the Domain Name,'.' and the XID.

columns.name: IS_MULTI_STOP
columns.description: Describes whether the itinerary contains more than one stop. If so, this column contains a Y for yes; if not it contains an N for no.

columns.name: PERSPECTIVE
columns.description: The perspective determines whether the itinerary is used for buy or sell shipment services. Perspective options include All (used for Buy and Sell), Buy, Sell.

columns.name: TOTAL_COST
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_COST_GID
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_COST_BASE
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_TRANSIT_TIME
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_TRANSIT_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_TRANSIT_TIME_BASE
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: USE_DECONSOLIDATION_POOL
columns.description: Orders matched to this itinerary may use a deconsolidation pool on the destination.

columns.name: USE_CONSOLIDATION_POOL
columns.description: Orders matched to this itinerary may use a consolidation pool on the source.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_WEIGHT
columns.description: Order bundles less than this weight will always go through a pool if the origin/destination of the order bundles fall into consolidation/deconsolidation pools.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the minimum stopoff weight.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Minimum stopoff weight in base units.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_WEIGHT
columns.description: The Maximum Pool Weight field identifies the highest weight for shipments that use the pool. If both of the max weight and volume fields are populated, the order needs to be less than these two values in order to be routed to a pool. If one field is populated, the order needs to be less than this value in order to be routed to a pool. If both are NULL, all orders qualify to be routed to a pool.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Weight unit of measure for the maximum pool weight.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum pool weight in base units.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_DELVS
columns.description: The maximum distance between deliveries is used to limit the distance between delivery stops. If the distance between two delivery stops exceed this value, orders are not paired.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_DELVS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum distance constraint.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_DELVS_BASE
columns.description: Maximum distance between deliveries in the base unit measure.

columns.name: TOTAL_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: Specifies the maximum number of stops on a multi-stop shipment derived from this itinerary.

columns.name: MIN_TL_WEIGHT
columns.description: This is the minimum weight to make up a nice truckload. It is also used as the minimum weight to go through a pool.

columns.name: MIN_TL_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The Unit of measure for the Minimum TL Weight.

columns.name: MIN_TL_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum TL weight in base units.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_VOLUME
columns.description: Order bundles less than this volume will always go through a pool if the origin/destination of the order bundles fall into consolidation/deconsolidation pools. When doing pool drop swapping, only pool drop shipments whose volume is bigger than this value are tried.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the Minimum Stopoff Volume.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The minimum stopoff volume in base units.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_VOLUME
columns.description: The maximum volume to go through a pool.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum pool volume.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The maximum volume to go through a pool in base units.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_VOLUME
columns.description: After pool swapping, the system attempts to pull off the orders that are close to parcel weight and ship direct, if the overall solution is cheaper. This volume guides the algorithm to only pull of the one that is smaller than this volume.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_VOL_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the small direct volume.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The small direct volume in base units.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_WEIGHT
columns.description: After pool swapping, the system tries to pull off the orders that are close to parcel weight and ship direct, if the overall solution is cheaper. This weight guides the algorithm to only pull of the one that is smaller than this weight.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_WGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for small direct weight.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The small direct weight in base units.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_WEIGHT
columns.description: The Max Cross Dock Weight field identifies the highest weight for shipments that use the cross dock. If both of the max weight and volume fields are populated, the order needs to be less than these two values in order to be routed to a cross dock. If one field is populated, the order needs to be less than this value in order to be routed to a cross dock. If both are NULL, all orders qualify to be routed to a cross dock.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum cross dock weight constraint.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum cross dock weight in the base unit measure.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_VOLUME
columns.description: The Max Cross Dock Volume field identifies the highest volume for shipments that use the cross dock.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum cross dock volume constraint.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: Maximum cross dock volume in the base unit measure.

columns.name: MIN_TL_USAGE_PERCENTAGE
columns.description: The percentage of usage to be used to determine whether a TL is full in bulk plan. This will guide whether direct shipment be kept without routing to pool. It also determines whether pool shipments be kept without routing to xdock.

columns.name: MIN_TL_VOLUME
columns.description: This is the minimum volume to make up a nice truckload. It is also used as the minimum volume to go through a pool

columns.name: MIN_TL_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for MIN_TL_VOLUME column.

columns.name: MIN_TL_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: MIN_TL_VOLUME in base units.

columns.name: IS_DEST_BUNDLE_PREFERED
columns.description: If this is selected, when going through the deconsolidation pool process, if there is a cross dock on this itinerary, two or more order bundles have the same destination will not route to the deconsolidation pool. It will route to cross dock later for consolidation at the cross dock and directly go to the destination.

columns.name: HAZMAT_MODE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the hazardous transport mode. It can be used to differentiate between goods from different orders that can be consolidated into one shipment for one or more legs of the trip.

columns.name: RANK
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: ITINERARY_TYPE
columns.description: By default, the Itinerary Type field displays Active which means that the itinerary can be used in shipment planning. Choose Inactive if you do not want this itinerary to be considered when building shipments. You can also choose Manual which means the itinerary should not be considered when running the Create Shipment - Bulk Plan, Direct, or Calculate Best Direct Cost actions. However, the itinerary is considered when running the Direct - Show Routing Options action.

columns.name: IS_RULE_11
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: INCO_TERM_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the INCO Term profile. The Incoterm Profile can be used to constrain the itinerary as a valid choice for shipment planning for any order that has the same Incoterm attributes as the profile. Note: If you use this field, you can also specify a Payment Method code on each leg of the itinerary which is then copied to the shipment that is built for that leg (overriding any Payment Method code defined on the order base).

columns.name: DEPOT_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the depot profile. The depot profile defines the lane and Source and/or Destination Depot Location that are considered during planning for service providers that start and end at depot locations.

columns.name: PICKUP_STOPS_CONSTRAINTS
columns.description: The total number of pickup stops for a multistop shipment. It is usually set to be the max of Pickup Stops Constraints of all valid rate offering. This helps multistop performance.

columns.name: DELIVERY_STOPS_CONSTRAINTS
columns.description: The total number of pickup stops for a multistop shipment. It is usually set to be the maximum of the Delivery Stops Constraints of all valid rate offering. This help multistop performance.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_PICKUPS
columns.description: In some cases, it is more expensive to ship to a cross-dock than to ship direct because of the distance from the source to the cross-dock. To limit the distance you want shipments to travel to a cross-dock, enter a numeric value in the Maximum Distance between Pickups/Deliveries fields. If the distance between two pickup or delivery stops exceed this value, orders are not paired.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_PICKUPS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum distance constraint.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_PICKUPS_BASE
columns.description: Maximum distance between pickups in the base unit measure.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_PICKUPS
columns.description: The distance from any pickup stop to the root bundle's source location can not exceed this distance.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_PICKUPS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the radius for pickups distance constraint.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_PICKUPS_BASE
columns.description: Radius distance for pickups in the base unit measure.

columns.name: RADIUS_PERCENTAGE_FOR_PICKUPS
columns.description: The distance from any pickup stop to the source location divided by the distance cannot exceed this percentage.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_DELVS
columns.description: The maximum radial - straight line distance - from the source to each delivery stop location that can not be exceeded.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_DELVS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the radius for deliveries distance constraint.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_DELVS_BASE
columns.description: Radius for deliveries distance constraint in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: RADIUS_PERCENTAGE_FOR_DELVS
columns.description: The maximum radial percentage distance from the source to each delivery stop location that can not be exceeded.

columns.name: IS_MATCH_DECONSOL_POOL_TO_DEST
columns.description: The Match Deconsol Pool to Dest check box sets the pool logic so that it matches orders to deconsolidation pools based on order's destination locations. If this is not selected, Oracle Transportation Management matches orders to deconsolidation pools according to the order's source location.

columns.name: IS_MATCH_CONSOL_POOL_TO_SRC
columns.description: The Match Deconsol Pool to Src check box sets the pool logic so that it matches orders to deconsolidation pools based on order's source location. If it is selected pool logic matches orders to consolidation pools based on order's source locations. If the check box is cleared, Oracle Transportation Management matches orders to consolidation pools according to the order's destination locations.

columns.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The list of compatible payment methods for the itinerary.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
